resources.string: Click to set request split position
If this option is enabled, requests to the server go through a SOCKS5 proxy
If this option is enabled, the HOST header changes to the specified
If this option is enabled, a dot is added after the server name
If this option is enabled, a tab is added after the server name
If this option is enabled, the space after the HOST header is removed
If this option is enabled, a space after the method is added
If this option is enabled, a newline is added before the method
If this option is enabled, the end of the line in UNIX style is used
This option enables DoH protocol support for DNS queries
Use DoH protocol only for sites in hostlist
If this option is enabled, the DoH protocol is used only for sites in the hostlist (requires enabling DoH protocol and hostlist support options)
If this option is enabled, DPI bypass methods are applied only to sites from the list (the list is located in the program folder and is updated with a button on the main screen)
Specifies the port on which the local HTTP proxy DPITunnel server is running
Set DPITunnel proxy with ROOT (requires root)
There was an error while updating hostlist
DPI Tunnel service isn\'t running. Please, run it
This option set path to hostlist file
Please grant required permissions. App can\'t work without them.
You can enter several DoH servers by entering them from a new line
Set DPITunnel proxy with VpnService (requires android 5 and high)
If this option is enabled, requests to the server go through a HTTP proxy
Start the service at boot system
Launch DPITunnel service on Android boot
Indicates where to download the hostlist file
Service is running. Please stop it before open settings
Replace SNI field in HTTPS ClientHello request
SNI will be replaced by this line. You can use ${SNI} to insert the original SNI
The author of this program is
DPI Tunnel is application that modifies your traffic in order to bypass DPI and give you free access to information.\nP.S. Please, don\'t skip this intro.
DPI Tunnel can work without root rights using VpnService API, but using root rights, it\'s possible to improves stability and efficiency. If you have root rights, please grant them.
An error occurred while getting root rights

If you want to use the SNI spoofing option, you need to install this SSL certificate for comfortable work. To do this, download it, open the device settings. Open Security-> Encryption & Credentials-> Install from SD Card. Select the downloaded certificate and install it.\nDon\'t worry about data security as it is processed locally.
